| alma_mater = Moscow Transportation Engineering Institute | occupation = Owner of [[Renova Group]] | known_for = | net worth = US$13.1 billion (August 2018)[https://www.forbes.com/profile/viktor-vekselberg/ Forbes: The World's Billionaires - Viktor Vekselberg] March 2013 | spouse = | children = | website = {{url|vekselberg.org}} |awards = {{plainlist | * [[File:Orden for Service IV.png|25px]] [[Order "For Merit to the Fatherland"]] (4th class) * [[File:Order of Alexander Nevsky 2010 ribbon.svg|25px]] [[Order of Alexander Nevsky]] * [[Decoration "For Beneficence"]] [http://en.kremlin.ru/events/president/news/53778 Presentation of state decorations] 26 January 2017, kremlin.ru }} }} '''Viktor Felixovich Vekselberg''' ({{lang-ru|Виктор Феликсович Вексельберг}}, {{lang-uk|Віктор Феліксович Вексельберг}}; born 14 April 1957) is a Ukrainian-born Russian businessman. He is the owner and president of [[Renova Group]], a large Russian conglomerate. According to ''[[Forbes]]'', his fortune is estimated at $13.6 billion, making him the fourth richest person in Russia, as of August 4, 2015.[https://www.forbes.com/profile/viktor-vekselberg/ Forbes: The World's Billionaires - Viktor Vekselberg] March 2013 Vekselberg is close to the [[Moscow Kremlin]],[https://www.esquire.com/uk/culture/news/a4399/russias-richest-man-victor-vekselberg Viktor Vekselberg: Tracking Down Russia's secret billionaire] 03 August 2013 By Stephen Smith, ''Esquire''[http://www.isn.ethz.ch/Digital-Library/Articles/Detail/?lng=en&id=88395 Vekselberg denies Kremlin influence] by Matthew Allen in Thun for Swissinfo, 27 May 2008 overseeing projects to modernize the Russian economy.[http://en.ria.ru/russia/20100323/158291374.html Russian 'Silicon Valley' to be self-sufficient in 5-7 years - Vekselberg] 19:44 23/03/2010, RIA Novosti In April 2018, the United States imposed sanctions on him and 23 other Russian nationals. On May 9, 2018, CNN reported that [[Special Counsel investigation (2017–present)|investigators from the Special Counsel investigation]] have questioned Vekselberg about hundreds of thousands of dollars in payments his company's US affiliate made to US President [[Donald Trump]]'s personal lawyer, [[Michael Cohen (lawyer)|Michael Cohen]].[https://edition.cnn.com/2018/05/08/politics/robert-mueller-russian-oligarch-payments-michael-cohen/index.html Exclusive: Mueller's team questions Russian oligarch about payments to Cohen]{{cite web |url=https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2018/05/michael-cohen-michael-avenatti-russian-oligarch-stormy-daniels-payment |title=Why Did Michael Cohen Receive $500,000 from a Russian Oligarch? |author=Abigail Tracy |date= |website=vanityfair.com |publisher= |access-date=May 17, 2018 |quote=}} ==Early life and education== Victor Vekselberg was born in 1957 to a [[Ukrainian-Jewish]] father and a [[Russians|Russian]] mother[https://archive.is/20120917180209/http://www.spiegel.de/spiegel/print/d-46146832.html Der Spiegel: "Im Westen wartet keiner auf mich" by Walter Von Mayr and Gerhard Spörl] March 6, 2006 (''in German'') | ''"Der alltägliche Antisemitismus ist nicht zu leugnen. Ich habe ihn selbst häufig zu spüren bekommen, obwohl ich unter Juden nicht als Jude gelte, da meine Mutter Russin ist. Die Russen wiederum halten mich nicht für einen Russen, weil mein Vater Jude ist"'' - ''"The everyday anti-Semitism is undeniable. I myself often get to feel it, even though I don't count as a Jew among the Jews, as my mother is Russian. The Russians in turn do not think I'm a Russian because my father is a Jew."''[https://www.theguardian.com/world/2007/jul/02/russia.lukeharding1 The Guardian: "The richer they come ...Can Russia's oligarchs keep their billions - and their freedom?" By Luke Harding] July 1, 2007 in [[Drohobych]], [[Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic]] (although some reports state that he was born in [[Lviv]]).Norris, Stephen M. [https://books.google.com/books?id=FA2uGQ-6jxcC&pg=PA251&lpg=PA251&dq=renova+holding+founded&source=bl&ots=GlynwD5GJ8&sig=k1O7mEzmNVAZCmeS4MlJVYF6n0M&hl=en&sa=X&ei=lxsaUu21KYuC9QSp-YDoBg&ved=0CCkQ6AEwADgo#v=onepage&q=renova&f=false "Blockbuster History in the New Russia: Movies, Memory, and Patriotism"] p. 251-253] In 1979, he graduated from the [[Moscow State University of Railway Engineering|Moscow Transportation Engineering Institute]]. Thereafter, he worked as an engineer and research manager at a state-owned pump manufacturer. [[File:RIAN archive 1006427 Presentation by Skolkovo Institute of Science and Technology.jpg|right|200px|thumb|Giving a presentation at the [[Skolkovo Institute of Science and Technology]]]] [[File:Dmitry Medvedev in the United States 23 June 2010-9.jpeg|thumb|Russian President [[Dmitry Medvedev]] witnessed the signing of a memorandum on cooperation between Governor of California [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] and Viktor Vekselberg, 23 June 2010]] ==Career== In 1988, after the [[Gorbachev]] administration relaxed restrictions on private business as part of his new policy [[Perestroika]] and [[Glasnost]], he founded NPO Komvek which did work for the Irkutsk Aluminum Plant and in 1990, he co-founded [[Renova Group]] with college classmate, [[Leonard Blavatnik]].[http://russiaprofile.org/bg_people/resources_whoiswho_alphabet_v_vekselberg.html Russia Profile: "VEKSELBERG, Victor Feliksovich"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130824210730/http://russiaprofile.org/bg_people/resources_whoiswho_alphabet_v_vekselberg.html |date=August 24, 2013 }} retrieved August 25, 2013 KomVek owned 67% of Renova and Blavatnik’s company [[Access Industries]] owned the remainder. He benefited financially from the privatization of the [[Aluminium in Russia#Privatisation|aluminum industry in Russia]] under the [[Boris Yeltsin|Yeltsin]] administration in 1993. In 1996, he co-founded the [[SUAL Group|Siberian-Urals Aluminium Company]] (SUAL) via a merger of the Ural and Irkutsk Aluminum Plants. (SUAL would later be incorporated into [[United Company RUSAL]], the largest aluminum company in the world). Using revenues generated from his aluminum business, he purchased a minority interest in Tyumen Oil (TNK), one of [[Russia]]'s largest oil and gas companies.[http://jewishbusinessnews.com/2013/04/09/with-7-5-billion-in-his-pocket-viktor-vekselberg-to-increase-his-shareholdings-in-switzerland/ "With $7.5 billion in his pocket, Viktor Vekselberg to increase his shareholdings in Switzerland" By Stanley Green], [[Jewish Business News]], April 9, 2013Yenikeyeff, Shamil, [http://www.oxfordenergy.org/wpcms/wp-content/uploads/2011/11/BP-Russian-billionaires-and-the-Kremlin.pdf "BP, Russian billionaires, and the Kremlin: a Power Triangle that never was"], ''Oxford Energy Comment'', November 23, 2011. Retrieved 2011-11-24. In 1997, he secured a controlling interest in Tyumen and was appointed to the Board of Directors; in 1998, he was appointed Chairman of the Board. Later, he integrated those and other assets under the umbrella of [[Renova Group]], delegating operating responsibilities to managers. In 2003, the Renova Group, along with [[Access Industries]] (owned by [[Leonard Blavatnik]]) and the [[Alfa Group]] (owned by [[Mikhail Fridman]], [[German Khan]], and [[Alexei Kuzmichov]]) announced the creation of a strategic partnership to jointly hold their oil assets in Russia and Ukraine, forming the AAR consortium. In the same year, they merged AAR with [[British Petroleum]]'s Russian oil assets in a 50-50 joint venture named [[TNK-BP]], the largest private transaction in Russian history.[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/newsbysector/energy/oilandgas/8516794/BP-in-Russia-a-timeline.html The Daily Telegraph: "BP in Russia: a timeline"] October 22, 2012 Acting as a chairman of the executive board of TNK, Vekselberg was instrumental in negotiating and closing the transaction. In 2010, Vekselberg was appointed President of the Skolkovo Foundation, a non-profit organization funded by a mix of private investors and the Russian government, with the goal of building a technology research hub in Russia.{{cite news |url=https://apnews.com/5e533f93afae4a4fa5c2f7fe80ad72ac/Sanctioned-Russian-oligarch-linked-to-Cohen-has-vast-US-ties |title=Sanctioned Russian oligarch linked to Cohen has vast US ties |publisher=[[The Associated Press]] |first=Garance |last=Burke |first2=Stephen |last2=Braun |date=July 5, 2018}} As its President, Vekselberg signed a deal for [[Cisco Systems]] to invest $1 billion over ten years into Skolkovo Foundation projects. The [[Federal Bureau of Investigations]] subsequently issued a statement claiming that the Skolkovo Foundation was being used by the Russian government to gain access to classified American technology. Vekselberg is now{{when|date=March 2017}} overseeing a vast restructuring of his assets: the division of property with the partner [[Leonard Blavatnik]], the merger of Renova's aluminum assets with those of [[Oleg Deripaska]], and the integration of various electricity and telecommunications investment. ==Art collection== In February 2004, Vekselberg purchased nine [[Fabergé egg|Fabergé Imperial Easter eggs]] from the [[Forbes family (publishers)|Forbes publishing family]] in New York City.Forbes, February 4, 2004: [https://www.forbes.com/2004/02/04/cx_pm_0204fabergesale.html Russian Tycoon Buys Forbes Faberge Eggs] The collection was transported to Russia and exhibited in the [[Kremlin]] and in [[Dubrovnik]] in 2007. Vekselberg is the single largest owner of Fabergé eggs in the world, owning fifteen of them (nine Imperial, two Kelch, and four other Fabergé eggs). In a 2013 [[BBC Four]] documentary, Vekselberg revealed that he had spent just over $100 million purchasing the nine Fabergé Imperial eggs from the Forbes collection.[http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b0336tf3 "The World's Most Beautiful Eggs: The Genius of Carl Faberge"] BBC FOUR He claims never to have displayed them in his home, saying he bought them because they are important to Russian history and culture, and he believed them to be the best jewelry art in the world. In the same BBC documentary, Vekselberg revealed plans to open a museum to display the eggs in his collection. The result was the [[Fabergé Museum in Saint Petersburg, Russia]], which had its official opening ceremony on November 19, 2013.{{Citation |url= http://www.fsv.ru/en/news/article/1 |title= The Fabergé Museum has officially opened in the Shuvalov Palace in St. Petersburg|publisher= Official website of the Link of Times Foundation |language= |accessdate = March 6, 2015}} In September 2006, Vekselberg agreed to pay approximately $1 million in expenses to transport the [[Lowell House]] Bells from [[Harvard University]] in the United States back to their original location in the [[Danilov Monastery]] and to purchase replacement bells. The historic bells returned to Moscow on September 12, 2008, with the assistance of the U.S. director of the organization, [[Edward Mermelstein]]. Vekselberg had paid £1.7 million at a [[Christie's]] auction in 2005 for ''Odalisque'', a nude said to be the work of Russian artist [[Boris Kustodiev]].{{Citation |url= http://www.artnews.com/2013/02/05/did-the-court-make-a-mistake/ |title= High Court Drama |publisher= Art News |language= |accessdate = March 6, 2015}} However, soon after the purchase, experts working for Vekselberg's art fund, Aurora, began to cast doubt on the picture's authenticity. They claimed that Kustodiev's signature, dated 1919, was done in aluminium-based pigment not available until after the artist's death in 1927. Vekselberg sued Christie's, and the judge ruled in July 2012 that he was entitled to recover the £1.7 million that he paid for the painting, plus Christie's was ordered to pay around £1 million in costs.{{Citation |url= https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/art/artsales/9432441/Russian-oligarch-wins-1.7m-refund-from-Christies-after-auction-house-sold-him-fake-painting.html |title= Russian oligarch wins £1.7m refund |publisher= www.telegraph.co.uk |language= |accessdate = March 6, 2015}} ==Charitable donations== Vekselberg's firm Renova donated between $50,000 and $100,000 to the [[Clinton Foundation]]."[https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/investigators-follow-flow-money-trump-wealthy-donors-russian/story?id=50100024 Special counsel probing flow of Russian-American money to Trump political funds]". ABC News. September 26, 2017. He donated $4.5 million to the construction of the $50 million [[Jewish Museum and Tolerance Center]] in Moscow, and is the chairman of the museum's board of trustees.[https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2012-11-08/peres-inaugurates-jewish-museum-funded-by-putin-vekselberg-1-.html Bloomberg: "Jewish Museum and Tolerance Center Peres Inaugurates Jewish Museum Funded by Putin, Vekselberg" By Ilya Arkhipov & Henry Meyer] November 8, 2012[http://www.interfax-religion.ru/?act=news&div=52009 Vekselberg headed the board of trustees of the Jewish Museum and Tolerance Center] Interfax, July 18, 2013 He finances the restoration and construction of [[synagogue]]s in Russia, including the construction of the Choral Synagogue in Saratov.[http://izrus.co.il/oligarhi/article/2015-02-03/26797.html Вексельберг построит синагогу в Саратове] Izrus, 03/02/2015 13:55 ==Personal life== He is married to Marina and has two children, a daughter and a son.[https://www.theguardian.com/business/2012/oct/23/rosneft-deal-viktor-vekselberg-russia-rich The Guardian: "Rosneft deal makes Viktor Vekselberg Russia's richest man" by Simon Goodley and Luke Harding] October 23, 2012 His father is Jewish, and his mother Christian. He identifies himself as multi-national and does not attend weekly synagogue or church services.[http://www.vesti7.ru/news?id=5147 Кого в России считать евреем?] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140310072218/http://www.vesti7.ru/news?id=5147 |date=March 10, 2014 }} Александр Рогаткин, Выпуск от 31.10.2004 Vekselberg is a longtime friend and business partner of British-American billionaire and major [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]] donor [[Leonard Blavatnik]],{{cite web|last1=May|first1=Ruth|title=GOP campaigns took $7.35 million from oligarch linked to Russia|url=https://www.dallasnews.com/opinion/commentary/2017/08/03/tangled-web-connects-russian-oligarch-money-gop-campaigns|website=Dallas News|date=3 August 2017}} who is close to [[Israel]]i Prime Minister [[Benjamin Netanyahu]]."[https://www.haaretz.com/us-news/kremlin-linked-billionaire-netanyahu-friend-donated-to-trump-s-legal-fund-1.5453274 Kremlin-linked Billionaire, Netanyahu Friend Donated to Trump's Private Legal Fund]". ''[[Haaretz]]''. September 25, 2017. ==Controversies== * In April 2009, Swiss Federal Finance Department initiated a criminal investigation against Vekselberg in connection to alleged violations of securities law.[http://www.nzz.ch/nachrichten/wirtschaft/aktuell/verfahren_vekselberg__1.2346394.html Strafverfahren gegen Vekselberg im Fall Sulzer]. 6.4.2009 As a result of the investigation, Vekselberg was fined $38m by Swiss authorities.[http://en.rian.ru/business/20100201/157736410.html Russian tycoon fined $38M in Switzerland, set to appeal fine]. Sputnik News. 01-02-2010 * In 2008, Vekselberg proxied a deal between Russian and Hungarian governments, buying the former embassy building from Hungary for $21m and immediately selling it to the Russian government for $116m, while the market price of the building was estimated at $50m. Investigation of the paper trail by [[Alexey Navalny]] and the Rospil project has found several invalid and backdated documents,{{cite web|url=http://navalny.livejournal.com/609880.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-07-31 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120625133702/http://navalny.livejournal.com/609880.html |archivedate=June 25, 2012 |df=mdy-all }} thus suggesting a [[collusion]] (e.g. the tender held by the Hungarian side was totally fictive, as the building was already sold by that time). Hungarian officials responsible for the deal (Tátrai Miklós, Marta Horvathne Fekszi and Arpad Szekely) were detained in February 2011.[http://www.osw.waw.pl/en/publikacje/ceweekly/2011-02-16/hungary-detentions-linked-to-sale-property-moscow Hungary: detentions linked to the sale of property in Moscow]. OSW. 2011-02-16 On the Russian side, a criminal investigation was only started in August 2013.[http://www.interfax.ru/russia/news.asp?id=322445 Возбуждено уголовное дело по факту хищения при приобретении Минрегионом здания в центре Москвы]. Interfax. 8 августа 2013. * In March 2018, members from [[Robert Mueller]]'s team of [[Special Counsel investigation (2017–present)|special counsel investigators]] questioned Vekselberg at a New York He is also the former [[President of the Dewan Negara]] and a former [[Terengganu State Legislative Assembly|Terengganu State Assemblyman]] for the seat of Bandar, [[Kuala Terengganu]] from 1995 to 1999. ==Early career== Wong was a civil servant in [[Ministry of Science, Technology and Environment (Malaysia)|Ministry of Science, Technology and Environment]] from 1978 to 1990 and later became a Consulting Engineer in 1991 upon leaving the government service. ==Political career== Wong made his debut in the [[Malaysian general election, 1990|1990 general election]] by contesting the Bandar, Kuala Terengganu state seat but lost. He was elected to the [[Terengganu State Legislative Assembly]] in the [[Malaysian general election, 1995|1995 general election]] but lost his seat in the subsequent [[Malaysian general election, 1999|1999 general election]].{{Cite news|title=A very precious 11 per cent, indeed|date=16 December 2008|work=[[New Straits Times]]}} He was appointed to the [[Dewan Negara|Senate]] in April 2004,{{Cite news|url=http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2004/5/15/nation/7987989&sec=nation|title=MCA man to become Senate deputy president|date=15 May 2004|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|accessdate=28 April 2010}} and elected as the Deputy President of the Senate in July the same year. He went on to became Senate President on 7 July 2009.{{Cite news|url=http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2009/7/4/nation/20090704150917&sec=nation|title=Datuk Wong Foon Meng is the next Senate
